CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 26, 1945, pg. 13 reads: "Keeping GI's Straight - Thirteen Negro military policemen, to patrol the Hill District and the Frankstown Avenue section of the East End, were added to the military police in Pittsburgh area and will be housed at the Bedford Avenue barracks. T/5 Amos Smothers (far right). who spent twenty-eight months overseas has Sgt. Stephen M. Harris, Philadelphia, and Pvt. James C. Feggins, Jersey City, N.J., check his papers. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Military police officers in uniform, from left: Sgt. Stephen M. Harris, Pvt. James C. Feggins, and Amos Smothers, standing in front of military vehicles
